did.abstract: Correspondence and papers, including a letter, 1863, written from Tullahoma, Tenn., to Lieut. Col. George W. Brent, giving a full account of the Confederate maneuvers after the campaign in Kentucky; a receipt given Major Norman B. Smith for a mule; a memorandum, 1864, by Hardee concerning troop movements near Savannah; a letter, 1865, to Hardee from Gen. Joseph Wheeler about Confederate and Union troop movements in South Carolina; and a business letter, 1871, to John L. Bridgers, of Tarboro, N.C.
